title: Longparish Walks

images.title: Peter Facey / Upper Mill, Longparish
images.caption: Upper Mill, Longparish "Upper Mill in East Aston was a working flour mill until about 1906 and was then used to supply electricity to Longparish House and the Mill. It ran a sawbench until the 1950s. Recently with much hard work Rupert Dawnay has restored the machinery, and it ran again in March 1998." - from

images.title: Chris Talbot / Longparish - Island In The Stream
images.caption: Island In The Stream. A small island in the River Dever.

images.title: Chris Talbot / Longparish - The River Test
images.caption: Looking east up the River Test from the bridge on Mill Lane.

images.title: Jim Champion / Oak and hazel woodland in Ladies' House Copse
images.caption: Oak and hazel woodland in Ladies' House Copse. A view north from the Test Way footpath between Pachington Piggery and the pig sheds in Pachington Copse.

images.title: Peter Facey / The Test Way passes The Old Cottage on Chilbolton Common
images.caption: The Test Way passes The Old Cottage on Chilbolton Common

description: This delightful village is located on the River Test in Hampshire. There's picturesque thatched cottages, old mills, weirs, pretty lakes and a fine old pub to visit here. This walk from the village takes you along a section of the Test Way to Harewood Forest , Wherwell and Chilbolton . The walk starts in the village and heads south west to neighbouring Middleton where you can pick up the Test Way and follow the waymarked footpath along the river to Forton. At Gavelacre you leave the river to head into the expansive Harewood Forest where there are miles of peaceful woodland trails to explore. The trail heads through the forest before coming to Wherwell. The route then crosses the river to head south into Chilbolton. Here you'll find the picturesque Chilbolton Common where there are some pretty old thatch cottages to see.
